Guideline/Issue: Abstract action names force the LLM to guess which tool to use.
Recommendation/Solution: Use actual function names like get_issue(), get_issues_by_team() instead of abstract descriptions. The agent knows exactly which function to call and what parameters it needs.
Example:
Good: Use get_issues_by_team(release_version, team_ids)
Bad: Run Retrieve Issues by Team

Guideline/Issue: Duplication wastes tokens and creates ambiguity.
Recommendation/Solution: Define concepts once, reference them elsewhere. Remove TODO sections and empty placeholders. Each token counts toward context limits.
Example: Define query once with [RELEASE_VERSION] placeholder, reference it for all freeze milestones

Topic: Principle 3: Conciseness - Assume the LLM is Smart
Guideline/Issue: Verbose meta-instructions about 'how to think' waste tokens.
Recommendation/Solution: Modern LLMs already know how to reason step-by-step. Don't teach them HOW to think, just WHAT to produce. Remove instructions like 'announce your findings,' 'commit to checking X first.'
Example:
Good: Data Sources (priority order): 1. Jira 2. Spreadsheet
Bad: Before retrieving data, identify sources, announce findings, commit to checking Jira first...

Guideline/Issue: Procedural 'do-this-then-that' steps constrain the agent's path-finding.
Recommendation/Solution: Lead with the destination (desired output), not the journey (procedure). Structure as Output → Data Requirements → Template, not Step 1 → Step 2 → Output.
Example:
Good: Output: Slack message
Data Requirements: 1. Freeze date 2. Team counts
Template: [template]
Bad: Step 1: Get date, Step 2: Get teams, Step 3: Fill template

Guideline/Issue: Output format must match BOTH platform AND delivery method. Slack has TWO formatting systems: mrkdwn (API) and Markdown (paste).
Recommendation/Solution: For copy-paste workflows use Markdown [text](url). For API/webhook use mrkdwn <url|text>. Match format to delivery method.

Guideline/Issue: Empty sections with TODO comments waste tokens.
Recommendation/Solution: Remove empty sections. They create confusion and waste context space.
Example:
Remove: ## Announce Code Freeze
(no content - TODO)

Guideline/Issue: Mixing Markdown and mrkdwn in same template.
Recommendation/Solution: Pick ONE syntax and use consistently throughout a template.
Example:
Bad: *RHDH 1.9.0 <url|Feature Freeze> Update*
(Markdown bold + mrkdwn link)

Guideline/Issue: Same JQL query repeated under different section names.
Recommendation/Solution: Define once, reference elsewhere to save tokens.
Example: Define base query once with [RELEASE_VERSION], note it applies to all freeze types

Guideline/Issue: Instructions about how to think ('carefully consider...').
Recommendation/Solution: State the constraint, trust the agent to reason. Remove meta-commentary.
Example:
Bad: Think carefully about whether Jira has dates
Good: Check Jira first, fallback to spreadsheet

Topic: Abstract Action Names Without Tool Mapping
Guideline/Issue: Using abstract action names instead of function names.
Recommendation/Solution: Always use actual function names from toolkit.
Example:
Bad: Run Retrieve Issues by Team
Good: Use get_issues_by_team(release_version, team_ids)

Guideline/Issue: Agent doesn't follow the extended prompt.
Recommendation/Solution: 1. Verify document sharing permissions 2. Check instruction clarity, use concrete function names 3. Contact technical team with doc URL and behavior details
Example: Use get_issue() instead of 'retrieve issue details'

Guideline/Issue: Technical team reports 'Failed to fetch extended system prompt'.
Recommendation/Solution: Fix sharing: Click Share → 'Anyone with link can view' OR add service account email. Verify correct URL shared.

Guideline/Issue: Updated doc but agent uses old instructions.
Recommendation/Solution: 1. Verify editing correct doc (check URL with tech team) 2. Check Markdown syntax errors 3. Request cache refresh from tech team
Example: Copy section into markdownlivepreview.com to verify syntax

Guideline/Issue: Instructions should be specific and agent-focused.
Recommendation/Solution: Be specific: describe exact output. Use examples: show formats. Think like agent: instruct the agent, not the user.
Example:
Good: Query Jira for status and present to user
Bad: Users should check Jira for status

Recommendation/Solution: Monthly: verify queries work, check Slack channels, review interactions. After process changes: update workflows immediately. After releases: conduct retrospective, gather feedback.
Example: Update Slack channels after team reorganization

Guideline/Issue: Use Format → Paragraph styles for headings.
Recommendation/Solution: Converts to Markdown # ## ### syntax. Don't manually make text bigger/bold.

Guideline/Issue: Use Ctrl+K to create links with descriptive text.
Recommendation/Solution: Converts to [text](url) format. Don't paste raw URLs.

Guideline/Issue: Use @ → 'Code blocks' or Insert → Building blocks.
Recommendation/Solution: For JQL queries and code snippets. Alternative: Courier New font. Converts to triple backtick format.
Example: Type @ then select 'Code blocks' for JQL query

Guideline/Issue: Use bullet/numbered list buttons, not manual typing.
Recommendation/Solution: Clean conversion to Markdown. Use Tab for indentation.
Example: Use list buttons, press Tab for nested items
